intro: Biscutella laevigata f. intermedia, commonly known as the intermediate biscuitroot, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with small, rounded leaves and clusters of yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or alpine environments. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens with suitable conditions.
